name: test_get_config[Default Mock Config]
description:
Verify the player behaves correctly when receiving a getConfig message (06) over the websocket.

    :param module_dut:
    :param mock_player_services_control:
descriptionHtml:
Verify the player behaves correctly when receiving a getConfig message (06) over the websocket.

:param module_dut:
:param mock_player_services_control:
statusTrace:
module_dut = SonosZoneComponent(id=140662963502224, ip=172.18.255.253, modelNumber=S36, serialNumber=0003861036E5, architecture=fury, hardware_version=1.36.1.0-1.0)
mock_player_services_control = <webserver.helpers.mock_player_cloud_services_control.MockPlayerCloudServicesControl object at 0x7fee98fec8d0>

    @pytest.mark.parametrize('config_properties', [None], ids=['Default Mock Config'])
    @pytest.mark.usefixtures('module_dut', 'mock_player_services_control')
    def test_get_config(module_dut, mock_player_services_control):
        """
        Verify the player behaves correctly when receiving a getConfig message (06) over the websocket.
    
        :param module_dut:
        :param mock_player_services_control:
        """
        zp = module_dut
        wait_until_true(lambda: len(mock_player_services_control.get_zp_registered(zp)) > 0, timeout_seconds=10, iteration_delay=1,
                        reason="Looking for <{}>'s registration message".format(zp.friendly_name))
    
        # Tell mock to send check alive to ZP
        mock_player_services_control.check_alive(zp)
    
        # Get the check alive response from the mock
>       wait_until_true(lambda: mock_player_services_control.get_last_check_alive(zp), timeout_seconds=10)

predicate = <function <lambda> at 0x7feea5f0a2a8>, iteration_delay = 1.05
timeout_seconds = 190.0, retry = None, info_threshold = 1.0, reason = ''
start_delay = 0.0, final_predicate = None

    def wait_until_true(predicate, iteration_delay=0.05, timeout_seconds=45,
                        retry=None, info_threshold=1.0, reason='', start_delay=0.0,
                        final_predicate=None):
        """
        Wait until predicate returns True.
    
        :param predicate: method which evaluates the wait condition and returns
            a boolean
        :type predicate: callable returning a bool
        :param float iteration_delay: number of seconds to sleep between each call
            to the predicate
        :param int timeout_seconds: number of seconds to wait for predicate to
            return True.
        :param retry: optional function to be called on each iteration
        :type retry: lambda or None
        :param float start_delay: Hard sleep before evaluating predicate. It will
            still use timeout_seconds thereafter to evaluate predicate.
        :param final_predicate: When passed the 'final_predicate' is used to make a final
            attempt of the condition being waited on.  The 'final_predicate' is useful to
            allow a predicate to log failure context for the wait loop in the event that
            the final attempt to validate the condition fails.
        :type final_predicate: callable returning a bool
        :return: The elapsed time until the condition was met in seconds
        :rtype: float
    
        """
        if start_delay > 0.0:
            logger.info("Won't evaluate for {} seconds".format(start_delay))
            time.sleep(start_delay)
        # avoid an int-to-float conversions every time through the loop
        timeout_seconds = float(timeout_seconds)
        iteration_delay = float(iteration_delay)
    
        timeout_increment, iteration_increment = get_wait_until_true_increments()
        if any([iteration_increment, timeout_increment]):
            logger.debug("Incrementing wait_until_true values: "
                         "timeout_seconds=%s, iteration_delay=%s",
                         timeout_increment, iteration_increment)
            timeout_seconds += float(timeout_increment)
            iteration_delay += float(iteration_increment)
    
        iterations = 0
        elapsed = 0.0
        t0 = time.time()
        while elapsed <= timeout_seconds:
            iterations += 1
            if predicate():
                elapsed = time.time() - t0
                if elapsed >= info_threshold:
                    logger.info("wait_until_true: Waited %s seconds" % elapsed)
                return elapsed
    
            # calculate elapsed time in case retry() takes non-trivial time
            guaranteed_sleep(iteration_delay)
            if retry:
                retry()
            elapsed = time.time() - t0
    
        # If we were passed a final_predicate, make a last attempt so the caller
        # can have a chance to log the failure context in the event of a final failure
        if final_predicate is not None:
            if final_predicate():
                # only log the wait time if it is 'significant' (defined somewhat
                # arbitrarily as >= 1 sec)
                elapsed = time.time() - t0
                logger.info("wait_until_true: Waited %s seconds" % elapsed)
                return elapsed
    
        raise TimeoutError('{}waited {:.4} seconds ({} iterations)'.format(
>           reason + ', ' if reason else '', elapsed, iterations))
E       TimeoutError: Timeout: waited 190.8 seconds (181 iterations)
